title: Nontoxic Definition & Meaning | Dictionary.com
description: Nontoxic definition, not of, relating to, or caused by a toxin or poison See more.
cleaned_text: nontoxic / (nntksk) / adjective not of, relating to, or caused by a toxin or poison: safe, nontoxic paint Words Nearby nontoxic Collins English Dictionary - Complete & Unabridged 2012 Digital Edition © William Collins Sons & Co. Ltd. 1979, 1986 © HarperCollins Publishers 1998, 2000, 2003, 2005, 2006, 2007, 2009, 2012 How to use nontoxic in a sentence Ketorolac, a generic, is considered a relatively nontoxic drug. [How Big Pharma Holds Back in the War on Cancer](http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2014/04/23/how-big-pharma-holds-back-in-the-war-on-cancer.html?source=dictionary)| ProPublica | April 23, 2014 [| THE DAILY BEAST](http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2014/04/23/how-big-pharma-holds-back-in-the-war-on-cancer.html?source=dictionary) And any nontoxic atmosphere will do, as long as there's enough oxygen in it.
